I'm running Kerbal with a gtx 780 ti, i5-4670k and installed onto an SSD. I am running with a moderate level of mods including the latest KW and KSO (with ATM, I'm at about 1,900mb). I am running at half texture resolution. I am getting this constant freeze in my frame rate. Sound is not interrupted only visual. This is also occurring in the VAB when I am assembling very large 3.75m or 5.0m boosters. Neither my cpu or gpu is being run at load so there is no hardware issue. I am wondering if others are experiencing this same issue and how they deal with it or if there is a secret key I am missing. I have a haunting suspicion it is KW or KSO, however, when I remove them the problem still occurs, perhaps I am just a conspiracy nut.

I think this is weird because I can run games like metro on max without batting an eye.
Google : Unity garbage collection or KSP garbage collection to see if either of those describe your problem. Are you running ksp in 64 or 32 bit?
This is a very old and well-known problem with Unity. http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/41900-Audio-skips-KSP-otherwise-jittery - read the last few pages.
